medical_history.chief_complaint: Right lower quadrant pain for 18 hours, associated with nausea, fever, and chills.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Pain began at noon yesterday, described as crampy and constant in the right lower quadrant. It worsened throughout the day to become sharp. Pain relieved somewhat by ibuprofen.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Primary sclerosing cholangitis, liver transplant history, neutropenia attributed to CMV infection and treatment with vanciclovir, bone marrow suppression with concern for HLH, cholecystectomy, chronic celiac artery occlusion, acute pancreatitis secondary to gall stone obstruction, depression, irritable bowel syndrome, fibromyalgia, GERD, hypertension.
medical_history.family_history: Mother had significant depression, alcohol abuse, and hypertension. Father had unspecified disease. Paternal grandmother had liver cancer.
